summary: The page has significant accessibility issues that should be addressed to improve usability for all users.
details: Several WCAG 2.1 compliance issues were identified, including color contrast problems, missing form labels, and keyboard navigation challenges. These issues impact users with visual impairments, motor disabilities, and those using assistive technologies.

issues.title: Insufficient color contrast
issues.description: Multiple text elements fail to meet the WCAG AA contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text.
issues.recommendation: Increase the contrast ratio between text and background colors to meet WCAG AA standards.

issues.title: Missing form labels
issues.description: Several form inputs lack proper label associations, making them difficult to use with screen readers.
issues.recommendation: Add explicit <label> elements with 'for' attributes that match input IDs.

issues.title: Missing ARIA landmark regions
issues.description: The page lacks proper ARIA landmark regions, making it difficult for screen reader users to navigate.
issues.recommendation: Add appropriate ARIA landmark roles to main page sections (header, nav, main, footer).

issues.title: Illogical keyboard focus order
issues.description: The tab order does not follow a logical sequence, creating confusion for keyboard users.
issues.recommendation: Restructure the tab order to follow a logical visual sequence from top to bottom, left to right.

issues.title: Missing alt text on images
issues.description: Several images lack alternative text, making them inaccessible to screen reader users.
issues.recommendation: Add descriptive alt text to all images, or empty alt attributes for decorative images.
